meanings.definition: A type of fried bread dough typically served with molasses or syrup.
meanings.sent1: I enjoyed a delicious touton for breakfast this morning.
meanings.sent2: The touton was crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.
meanings.sent3: As I bit into the touton, molasses dripped down my chin.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of freshly fried toutons filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: Grandma's secret recipe for toutons always makes them perfect.

meanings.sent1: The company decided to touton their new product to attract customers.
meanings.sent2: She always knows how to touton her friends' achievements.
meanings.sent3: He would touton his favorite sports team even when they were losing.
meanings.sent4: The actor took to social media to touton his upcoming movie.
meanings.sent5: The teacher would always touton her students' hard work in class.

meanings.definition: A person who solicits business or employment aggressively.
meanings.sent1: The touton outside the store was trying to get people to sign up for a credit card.
meanings.sent2: The touton was known for being persistent in getting new clients.
meanings.sent3: The touton approached every passerby with a big smile and a handshake.
meanings.sent4: The touton's energetic personality made them successful in sales.
meanings.sent5: The touton's sales pitch was so convincing that many people stopped to listen.
